title: PivotMIA
subtitle: Liberty & Co., 2022
description: This conference, hosted by podcast hosts Kara Swisher and Scott Galloway, featured the hottest names in business, fintech, media, and more. Interviews, panel discussions and presentations took place on stages at the 1 Hotel in Miami Beach, over lunch on the beach and at a theatrical dinner experience at Faena.

title: Johnnie Walker Whisky Workshop
subtitle: Giant Spoon, 2021
description: Johnnie Walker partnered with Brooklyn-based artist Mike Perry to produce a collection of cocktail accessories for the holiday season. To promote and sell them, we built a pop-up store in The Shops at Columbus Circle, complete with custom engraving stations and a sampling bar.

title: PMI Virtual Experience Series
subtitle: Liberty & Co., 2020-ongoing
description: To help PMI reimagine their yearly series of conferences for project management professionals in a virtual setting, we designed a suite of 3D-rendered backdrops for an online event platform. The backgrounds provide a visual metaphor related to the theme of each installment and have evolved to tell a growing story over the course of the series.

title: Reacher Challenge
subtitle: Tool of N.A., 2021
description: To celebrate the premiere of Amazon Prime Video's newest series, we built a pop-up obstacle course in three cities and invited the public to recreate Jack Reacher's special-ops feats.

title: Ally Digital Dollar AR
subtitle: Tool of N.A., 2021
description: This limited-time AR game turned regular, everyday dollar bills into valuable prizes. Scanning the front of the bill with the camera on an AR-capable device made it morph into a luminescent cube that descended into a prize-awarding piece of digital machinery. I created AR-ready 3D assets and animation clips for use in an 8th Wall-developed web app.

title: Takeda WHF & ISTH
subtitle: ImpactXM, 2020
description: This pair of exhibits, initially for two international heart health conferences in Europe and Asia, were designed around modularity and the need to adapt to variably sized footprints throughout their life cycle. Because of the complex regulatory needs around medical marketing, the exhibits appear as two separate experiences when approached from opposite sides.

title: Maserati Trofeo Launch
subtitle: Giant Spoon, 2020
description: Maserati's ultra-high-end Trofeo collection, a racing-inspired trim of some of their popular models, was slated to make its debut at this offsite experience during the 2020 NY International Auto Show. Due to the Javits Center's conversion into a hospital for the early stages of the COVID-19 pandemic, NYIAS was indefinitely postponed that year and the designs shown here were shelved. Guests were to be led through a multisensory experience highlighting the history, design, sounds and luxurious features of the vehicles.

title: IBM MWC & THINK
subtitle: Tool of N.A., 2020
description: IBM's many IT infrastructure, AI and cloud computing technologies have uses in every industry and scenario imaginable. To help them visualize the variety and versatility of these solutions, we created a series of interactive physical-digital installations to tell specific stories of those technologies in use as governments and business respond to natural disasters, move products around the world, or integrate smart devices into our daily lives. Developed for Mobile World Congress and later use at IBM's own THINK conference.

title: Microsoft Inspire
subtitle: INVNT, 2019
description: Microsoft's yearly conference and networking event for their partner businesses features a keynote presentation by CEO Satya Nadella along with larger presentations and demos around the main stage. Held in the massive T-Mobile Arena, our focus was on making the presentation content visible to the live and online streaming audiences through the use of massive overhead, underfoot and wrap-around LED video.

title: JLG Conexpo
subtitle: RES Exhibit Services, 2019
description: Conexpo—the construction trade show—is all about enormous machines building enormous projects. Since their products would never fit inside an exhibition hall, equipment-makers JLG and their competitors take to the parking lot where they erect their own pavilions. We designed a set of three structures for consideration and explored their features through video and interactive web-based walkthroughs made with Unreal Engine.

title: Intel Mega
subtitle: Tool of N.A., 2018
description: Visitors to Intel's sprawling CES exhibit were treated to experience the company's vision for emerging technologies—autonomous vehicles, 5G, artificial intelligence and virtual reality—through an immersive, multimedia adventure. The design was considered as a standalone experience and integrated into the larger exhibit plan by Taylor Group.
